glsa.title: FileZilla: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in a bundled copy of PuTTY in FileZilla might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

background.p: FileZilla is an open source FTP client.

description.p: FileZilla is affected by the same vulnerability as reported in “GLSA 201703-03” because the package included a vulnerable copy of PuTTY. Please read the GLSA for PuTTY referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker, utilizing the SSH agent forwarding of an SSH server, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running FileZilla or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All FileZilla users should upgrade to the latest version:
